sen.j: 澤 宣嘉（さわ のぶよし、1836年2月9日（天保6年12月23日 (旧暦)） - 1873年（明治6年）9月27日））は、幕末期の公卿、明治の政治家である。
sen.e: Nobuyoshi SAWA (February 9, 1836- September 27, 1873) was Kugyo (high court noble) in the end of the Edo period and a politician in the Meiji period.
Nobuyoshi SAWA (February 9, 1836-September 27, 1873) was Kugyo (high court noble) in the end of the Edo period and a politician in the Meiji period.
sen.cmt: ハイフン後のスペース削除しました。
sen.e: Nobuyoshi SAWA (February 9, 1836-September 27, 1873) was Kugyo (high court noble) in the end of the Edo period and a politician in the Meiji period.
His childhood name was Kumamaro (隈麿).
sen.cmt: 隈麿の読み方不明です。
sen.e: His childhood name was Kumamaro (隈麿).
His childhood name was Kumamaro (隈麿).
His go (byname) was Shunsen (春川) and Shoshun (小春).
sen.cmt: 春川、小春の読み方不明です。
sen.e: His pseudonyms were Shunsen (春川) and Shoshun (小春).
sen.cmt: 複数化、「号」を変更しました。
sen.e: His pseudonyms were Shunsen (春川) and Shoshun (小春).
His nick name was Mondo no tsukasa (主水司).
sen.cmt: 主水司の読み方不明です。
sen.e: His popular name was Mondo no tsukasa (主水司).
sen.cmt: 「通称」を変更、「主水司」は「しゅすいし」「もんどのつかさ」「もいとりのつかさ」のどれかかと思われます。
sen.e: His popular name was Mondo no tsukasa (主水司).

sen.j: 1836年、公卿姉小路公遂の5男として生まれる。
sen.e: In 1836 he was born as the fifth son of Kinsui ANEGAKOJI (姉小路公遂) who was Kugyo.
sen.cmt: 姉小路公遂の読み方不明です。
sen.e: In 1836, he was born as the fifth son of Kinsui ANEGAKOJI who was a Kugyo.
sen.cmt: コンマ挿入、冠詞挿入、「あねがこうじきんすい」としました。
sen.e: In 1836, he was born as the fifth son of Kinsui ANEGAKOJI who was a Kugyo.

sen.j: のち、公卿澤為量の継養子となる。
sen.e: Later, he was adopted as a heir of Tamekazu SAWA who was Kugyo.
Later, he was adopted as the heir of Tamekazu SAWA who was a Kugyo.
sen.cmt: 冠詞変更、冠詞挿入しました。
sen.e: Later, he was adopted as the heir of Tamekazu SAWA who was a Kugyo.

sen.j: 1858年（安政5年）の日米修好通商条約締結の際は養父・為量と共に勅許に反対して廷臣八十八卿列参事件にかかわる。
sen.e: At the time of the conclusion of Treaty of amity and commerce between the United states and Japan in 1858, he was against the imperial sanction and involved in the Demo of eighty-eight retainers of Imperial Court with his foster father Tamekazu.

At the time of conclusion of Treaty of amity and commerce between the United States and Japan in 1858, he was against the imperial sanction and involved in the Demo of eighty-eight retainers of Imperial Court with his adoptive father Tamekazu.
sen.cmt: 冠詞削除、大文字化、fosterを変更しました。
sen.e: At the time of conclusion of Treaty of amity and commerce between the United States and Japan in 1858, he was against the imperial sanction and involved in the Demo of eighty-eight retainers of Imperial Court with his adoptive father Tamekazu.

sen.j: 以後、朝廷内において尊皇攘夷派として活動した。
sen.e: After that, he worked as Sonno Joi ha (supporters of the doctrine of restoring the emperor and expelling the barbarians) in the Imperial Court.
After that, he worked as Sonno Joi ha (supporters of the doctrine of restoring the emperor and expelling the barbarians) in the Imperial Court.
After that, he worked as Sonno Joi ha (supporters of the doctrine of restoring the emperor and expelling the barbarians) in the Imperial Court.

sen.j: 1863年（文久3年）に会津藩と薩摩藩が結託して長州藩が京都から追放された八月十八日の政変により朝廷から追放されて都落ちする（七卿落ち）。
sen.e: By the Coup of August 18 in which the Choshu clan was exiled by the Aizu clan and the Satsuma clan in 1863, he was exiled from the Imperial Court in Kyoto (the exile of the Seven nobles from Kyoto).

By the Coup of August 18 in which the Choshu domain was exiled from Kyoto by the Aizu domain and the Satsuma domain in 1863, he was exiled from the Imperial Court in Kyoto (the exile of the Seven nobles from Kyoto).
sen.cmt: from Kyotoを追加、「藩」をdomainに変更しました。
sen.e: By the Coup of August 18 in which the Choshu domain was exiled from Kyoto by the Aizu domain and the Satsuma domain in 1863, he was exiled from the Imperial Court in Kyoto (the exile of the Seven nobles from Kyoto).

sen.j: 長州へ逃れた後は各地へ潜伏し、平野国臣に擁立されて但馬国生野で挙兵する（生野の変）。
sen.e: After he escaped to the Choshu domain, he kept himself hidden in various places and rose an army at Ikuno in the Tajima Province, supported by Kuniomi HIRANO (Ikuno Incident).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: After he escaped to the Choshu domain, he kept himself hidden in various places and then rose an army at Ikuno in Tajima Province, supported by Kuniomi HIRANO (Ikuno Incident).
sen.cmt: 冠詞削除、thenを挿入しました。
sen.e: After he escaped to the Choshu domain, he kept himself hidden in various places and then rose an army at Ikuno in Tajima Province, supported by Kuniomi HIRANO (Ikuno Incident).

sen.j: が、3日で逃亡して再度長州藩に逃れる。
sen.e: However, three days later, he escaped again to the Choshu domain.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, three days later, he escaped again to the Choshu domain.
However, three days later, he escaped again to the Choshu domain.

sen.j: 1867年（慶応3年）の王政復古 (日本)の後は、参与、九州鎮撫総督、長崎府知事などの要職を務めた。
sen.e: After the Restoration of Imperial Rule in 1867, he had held important positions such as Sanyo (Councilor), Kyusyu Chinbu-sotoku (the general of placating Kyushu) and the governor of the Nagasaki-fu.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: After the Restoration of Imperial Rule in 1867, he had held important positions such as Sanyo (Councilor), Kyusyu Chinbu-sotoku (the general of placating Kyushu) and the governor of the Nagasaki-fu.
After the Restoration of Imperial Rule in 1867, he held important positions such as Sanyo (Councilor), Kyusyu Chinbu-sotoku (the general of placating Kyushu) and the governor of the Nagasaki-fu.

sen.j: 1869年（明治2年）に外国官知事から外務卿になり、外交に携わるが38歳の若さで病死した。
sen.e: He was promoted to Gaimukyo (chief of Foreign Ministry) from Gaikokan chiji (governor of foreign affairs) in 1869, but died of disease at the tender age of 38.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He was promoted to Gaimukyo (chief of Foreign Ministry) from Gaikokan chiji (governor of foreign affairs) in 1869, but died of disease at the tender age of 38.
He was promoted to Gaimukyo (chief of Foreign Ministry) from Gaikokan chiji (governor of foreign affairs) in 1869, but died of disease at the tender age of 38.

sen.j: 九州鎮撫総督長崎着任後、浦上のキリスト信徒たちを呼び出して改宗を説得した。
sen.e: After he was assigned to Kyusyu Chinbu-sotoku and arrived Nagasaki, he called Christians of Uragami and tried to persuade them to convert.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: After he was assigned to Kyusyu Chinbu-sotoku and arrived Nagasaki, he called Christians of Uragami and tried to persuade them to convert from Christianity.
After he was assigned to Kyusyu Chinbu-sotoku and arrived Nagasaki, he called Christians of Uragami and tried to persuade them to convert from Christianity.

sen.j: が、改宗の意思が無い事から「中心人物の処刑と一般信徒の流罪」と言う厳罰の提案を新政府に提出、浦上四番崩れを引き起こした。
sen.e: However, since they did not want to convert, he proposed a severe punishment such as 'an execution of central character and exiles of common believers,' which led to Urakamiyobankuzure (oppression for Christians in Nagasaki).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, since they did not want to convert, he proposed a severe punishment such as 'execution of central character and exile of common believers' to the new government, which led to Urakamiyobankuzure (oppression for Christians in Nagasaki).
sen.cmt: 冠詞削除、単数化、「新政府」が抜けていたので補完しました。
sen.e: However, since they did not want to convert, he proposed a severe punishment such as 'execution of central character and exile of common believers' to the new government, which led to Urakamiyobankuzure (oppression for Christians in Nagasaki).

sen.j: 萩黒川にある藩主本陣・森田邸(吉田松陰養母実家にあたる)に逗留し、兵学、外国情勢などを学ぶ。
sen.e: He stayed at Morita house (the family home of the foster mother of Shoin YOSHIDA) which was Honjin (a hotel) of lord of domain at Kurokawa of Hagi, and learned military science, foreign affairs and so on.

He stayed at Morita house (the family home of the foster mother of Shoin YOSHIDA) which was Honjin (a hotel) of the lord of domain at Kurokawa in Hagi, and learned military science, foreign affairs and so on.
sen.cmt: 冠詞追加、前置詞変更しました。
sen.e: He stayed at Morita house (the family home of the foster mother of Shoin YOSHIDA) which was Honjin (a hotel) of the lord of domain at Kurokawa in Hagi, and learned military science, foreign affairs and so on.

sen.j: 萩大井にある寺院（阿字雄邸）に匿われた。
sen.e: He was hidden in a temple at Oi of Hagi (Ajio house).
He was sheltered in a temple at Oi of Hagi (Ajio house).
He was sheltered in a temple at Oi of Hagi (Ajio house).

sen.j: なお阿字雄邸には澤宣嘉が所持していた刀とその小物類、澤宣嘉から贈呈されたと云われる明治天皇の服が伝わっている
sen.e: At Ajio house, there remain a sword and its accessories of Nobuyoshi SAWA and a cloth of the Emperor Meiji which was said to be presented by Nobuyoshi SAWA.
At Ajio house, there remain a sword and its accessories of Nobuyoshi SAWA and clothes of Emperor Meiji which is said to have been presented by Nobuyoshi SAWA.
sen.cmt: 服をclothesに変更、冠詞削除しました。
sen.e: At Ajio house, there remain a sword and its accessories of Nobuyoshi SAWA and clothes of Emperor Meiji which is said to have been presented by Nobuyoshi SAWA.
